intro: Hieracium nigrisquamum, commonly known as the black-squamate hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is recognized by its dark, scaly leaves and yellow ray florets. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Hieracium nigrisquamum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
